snippet: New federal regulations, to take effect in 90 days, ban the sale of e-cigarettes to minors and require producers to disclose ingredients to regulators.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration announces new regulations on e-cigarettes, banning their sale to minors and imposing restrictions on producers; industry warns rules will harm smaller companies without resources to meet requirements; public health experts are divided over whether devices encourage traditional cigarette smoking or help people quit.
lead_paragraph: New federal regulations, to take effect in 90 days, ban the sale of e-cigarettes to minors and require producers to disclose ingredients to regulators.

headline.main: F.D.A. Imposes Rules for E-Cigarettes in a Landmark Move
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Forbids Sale to Minors of E-Cigarettes
